summary: The classic story of an innocent man wrongly, but deliberately imprisoned and his brilliant strategy for revenge against those who betrayed him. Dashing young sailor Edmond Dantes (Jim Caviezel) is a guileless and honest young man whose peaceful life and plans to marry the beautiful Mercedes (Dagmara Dominczyk) are abruptly shattered when his best friend Fernand (Guy Pearce), who wants Mercedes for himself, deceives him.

reviews.content: A faithful adaption to the amazing story of the Count of Monte Cristo.
Well acted and good adaptation of a beloved novel
My all time favorite movie
I really liked this movie the first time I saw it. I watch it at least once a year. Good cast and faithful to Dumas' book.
One of my favorite adventure/dramas to watch.  They modified the original novel but every choice was for the benefit of the movie.
Watching young Henry Cavill was particularly pleasing

This is an easy 5/5 as it is hands down my favorite movie of all time. Brilliantly acted by Jim Caviezel & Guy Pierce. The Count of Monte Cristo is an age old tale of love, friendship, betrayal, vengeance and redemption that never fails to miss the mark both visually and in the plot. Must see.

This movie has to be in my top ten favorite movies of all time!
This film has everything... Romance, suspense, drama, a bit of comedy and loads of action.
The book "The Count of Monte Cristo" was written by Alexandre Dumas (the same author who gave us "The Three Musketeers") in 1844 and this film follows closely to the book (which is a large reason why it is so great), with a few minor changes to the ending.
The acting is superb!  Jim Caviezel was outstanding as the lead character (Edmond Dontes), Guy Pearce providing a memorable performance, Henry Cavill in one of his first films shows that he was talented at an early age and Dagmara Domińczyk held her own against this amazing cast! Other notable actors are Richard Harris (an award-winning and celebrated actor in his own right) was outstanding in his role as "the Priest," who teaches and guides our main character through difficult times.  Luis Guzmán as Edmond Dontes's faithful companion played a bit of comic relief in an ingenious way.  James Frain was also brilliant in his role as a corrupt politician.
There are many more actors who had phenomenal performances as well at this whole cast was in concert to bring this story to life the way it was meant to be told.
Absolutely wonderful telling of the classic Alexander Dumas tale!
If I'm going on an island for life and can take only one movie this is it serious
A brilliant movie of revenge and betrayal. One of my top ten movies. The casting is great and the music fits perfectly with each scene.  A great adaptation.
Absolutely amazing film based on an indisputable classic of a novel.
My favorite movie, what else can I say, if I had to watch only one film from a solar powered tv/dvd combo on a deserted island this would be it.

For how incredible the movie is, it does wrap up quite abruptly despite being 2+ hours. I believe the final chapters could do to be lengthened another 20 minutes or so. It's a perfect story of vengeance and redemption. Plotted maniacally and with purpose, cold to the bone and ever so rewarding. That's my only sticking point, otherwise this is a perfect movie and casted so well. You hate the bad guys and root for the good, this movie has everything. Don't just add it to your list, watch it next - watch it now, what are you waiting for? (Seen it about 7-8 times)
Such an amazing classic! That's really all I have to say. Just watch it!

Napoleon Bonaparte in 1814 was banished to the island of Elba 
Anyone would be executed trying to come after him no matter how innocent or guilty 
Jim Cavizel, Guy Pearce, Henry Cavill, Dagmara Dominiczky, Luis Guzman, the late Richard Harris, and the late Helen McCrory star in one of many adaptations of the beloved 1844 story by Alexandre Dumas
Edmond Dantes and his ally Fernand Mondego arrive on Elba assisting Napoleon's wounded men 
Edmond is then tasked delivering a letter back to the mainland to Morell & Company Shipping and is promoted to Captain 
He then intends to marry his girlfriend Mercedes 
Unfortunately Fernand grows increasingly jealous of him and sets him up to be imprisoned while also stealing away Mercedes from him 
During his incarceration at Chateau'If Edmond seeks the help of fellow prisoner Abbe Faria to fight and he creates a new identity for himself 
He goes under the guise of a Count being fabulously wealthy seeking revenge against Fernand but also finding lost treasure of Monte Cristo 
This is a swashbuckler that lines up motifs of passion and stays true to the essence of the novel 
More of a slow builder of an adventure; takes an hour and 14 min to get to the crux of of things with Edmond planning his revenge heading off to Paris 
It boils down to learning Fernand and his allies' weaknesses pulling them out like they did to him 
Still the film has quite the art direction and style 
Won't win any new heights as far as artistic vision 
Revenge is sweet yet hard to let go 
This adaptation will be fun for some if not all
Really good movie. No gratuitous violence, solid acting, excellent soundtrack. It's a classic that is done well.
A good movie, a well-chosen cast, it had me crying in some moments but, disappointingly, it is too far from Alexandre Dumas' book. I wish one day someone would make a really faithful screen version,
The greatest movie of all time.

It's nothing particularly new. It's a semi swashbuckling tale, with sword fighting. Jim Caviziel's performance is reasonably good. It's not a career defining performance but it's not bad either. All in all, watch it, or dont. You're not missing much.

Fantastic adaptation of the Dumas classic although it takes a slight detour in the end which changes the story into one of divine justice and not necessarily revenge. Jim Caviezel plays the Innocent Dantès who's life is destroyed by his supposed friend Mondego (Pearce) with the help of Villefort (Frain). Caviezel plays this naive character who changes into a even greater, more scheming and more vindictive character than Pearce. Both play their roles with aplomb. Luis Guzmán as Jacopo steals nearly every scene that he's in as he seems to represent the last remaining remnant of a conscience that Dantes may still possess. When I first saw this film, knowing the vengeful turn the novel takes, I thought it odd that Mondego's son Albert (played by a young Henry Cavill) bears no resemblance to his father, Fernand Mondego (Pearce) and how Albert seems to resemble another. Dagmara Domińczyk, who plays the hapless Mercedes, seems to be the most loving character, who has never forgotten Edmond and the love she held for him. She was like Dantes an innocent in this story who was never a schemer, but only took advantage, out of necessity. when Dantes is taken away. Finally, Richard Harris as Abbé Faria is the voice that cries out in the wilderness that God will carry Dantes through all of this and that God will give him justice. The reveal in the end is the most satisfying morsel of this morality play and it is reflective of Abbé Faria's words to Dantes' in the Chateau d'If and in the words of Jacobo: "Once again Zatara, God sees you out the corner of his eye." For although Dantes had suffered for over 13 years, God kept him whole for the reward and justice he always deserved.

Uno de mis libros favoritos de la pluma del ingenioso Alexandre Dumas Sr. 
Nos cuenta una historia llena de misterio, drama, mapas de tesoros y sobre todo venganza. 
Edmund Dantes (Jim Caviezel) es culpado injustamente de un crimen que lo hará pasar años en prisión, todo orquestrado por su "mejor" amigo, Fernand Mondego (Guy Pearce) por su amor por Mercedes (Dagmara Dominczyk). 
La película es divertida, interesante y creo que es una buena adaptación del libro en cuestión; no me gusta comparar libros con películas porque considero que es innecesario por ser diferentes ámbitos artísticos. 
Es una película que disfruto mucho por las actuaciones y las locaciones donde fue filmada, es una historia clásica que no pasará de moda y que aún hoy, sigue estando vigente.

A stunning depiction of an incredible novel with a lazy ending compared to the original. However, this Hollywood ending doesn't do so much damage to a movie that is otherwise a great collector's item.
How hard do We have to push for justice?

A compelling story about vengeance and suffering leads the many great aspects of this criminally underrated 2002 movie. The Count of Monte Cristo is very passionate with how it tells its tale and how it guides its characters and their journeys.
Excelente filme. Ademais, não é uma obra de ficção perfeita, mas trás consigo elementos simples, que tornam um filme gostoso de assistir.
A huge fan of the novel, this movie lives up to my expectations. It's wonderful.
Fun action film that may have changed too much of the book.

Touches the heart strings with love, hate, sadness and sweet revenge!! The anticipation of each emotion isn't drawn out and satisfied in the perfect passing of time!! Jim Caviezel is unequalled in past interpretations of Edmond Dantes! His soul is seen without blemish on his face every time he spoke! I enjoyed it completely!

A quality interpretation of a romantic period masterpiece.  Alexander Dumas would be proud of this bold effort at mirroring a historic masterpiece.  The movie portrays The Count Of Monte Cristo not so much as a story of the cathartic nature of revenge but of the freedom which comes only from true redemption.
